result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle D Betts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONSECUTIVE, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.
Conditions the same as probation, except for condition time.

miscConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, and assessments, while on probation or serve 10 days in the HOC. Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.
Seek and maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.
No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Defendant to be in some type of aftercare and or treatment during the whole term of probation.
 Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests, and breathalyzers.
Live with his father, unless agent approves otherwise.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Consecutive.  STAYED: to be used by agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 30 days for the third violation.  Defendant should then be revoked.

Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions-Domestic Violence Court received and filed./ds

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Konkol
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ x  ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment

Defendant Kyle D Betts in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Kyle D Betts in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Patricia Daugherty. 

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Father, David B.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, 6 MONTHS, CONSECUTIVE, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  If defendant is revoked, same conditions apply to extended supervision as conditions of probation, except for the condition time.

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:

- 60 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 30 days for the third violation.  Defendant should then be revoked.
- Defendant to be in some type of aftercare and or treatment during the whole term of probation.
- Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests, and breathalyzers.
- Complete 30 hours of community service.
- Seek and maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.
- Live with his father, unless agent approves otherwise.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, and assessments, while on probation or serve 10 days in the HOC.  
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular payments.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Kyle D Betts not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 6/9/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kyle D Betts in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Kyle D Betts in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kyle D Betts in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Kyle D Betts in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
